PF2E.ActionBrowserSearchHint:
Puedes buscar por nombre o características personalizadas. Los posibles atributos a buscar son:
tipo de conjuro, nivel, escuela, componentes, materiales, objetivo, rango, tiempo, duración, daño, tipo de daño, salvación, concentración, ritual, característica y clases.
Ejemplo: 'fuego, daño:d6' para mostrar todos los conjuros que tienen fuego en su nombre y un d6 en el daño.

Notes.NoTarget: Diferencia de tamaño Tienes una penalización de -2 por circunstancia a tu chequeo si el objetivo es de un tamaño mayor que el tuyo y una penalización de -4 por circunstancia si es mayor que eso. Obtienes una bonificación de +2 de circunstancia a tu chequeo si el objetivo es de un tamaño inferior al tuyo y una bonificación de +4 de circunstancia si es inferior.
Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Golpeas al enemigo y la energía mágica lo abruma. La criatura es derribada @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{tumbado}, pasa a estar @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{deslumbrado} durante 1 Asalto, y recibe un daño igual a [[/r 2d6 + @abilities.str.mod # Damage: Arcane Slam]]{2d6 más tu modificador de Fuerza}. El adversario ya no se encuentra @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrado} o @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{inmovilizado} por ti.
Notes.success: Éxito Golpeas al enemigo. La criatura es derribada @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{prone} y recibe un daño igual a [[/r @abilities.str.mod # Damage: Arcane Slam]]{Strength modifier}. El adversario ya no se encuentra @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrado} o @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{inmovilizado} por ti.
Notes.failure: Fallo No puedes golpear a la criatura, pero tu control sobre ella se mantiene.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico La criatura se libera y deja de estar @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrada} o @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{inmovilizada} por ti.

Notes.criticalSuccess:
Éxito Critico @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{No eres detectado} por la criatura durante tu movimiento y sigues sin ser detectado por la criatura al final del mismo.

Revisa la acción @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sigilo} para mas detalles.
Notes.success:
Éxito @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{No eres detectado} por la criatura durante tu movimiento y sigues sin ser detectado por la criatura al final del mismo.

Revisa la acción @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sigilo} para mas detalles.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Te mueves hasta tu Velocidad.
Notes.success: Éxito Te mueves hasta tu Velocidad, como si estuvieras en terreno difícil (cada 5 pies [1,5 m] te cuestan 10 pies [3 m] de movimiento).
Notes.failure: Fallo Debes permanecer estacionario para mantener el equilibrio (malgastando la acción) o te caes. Si te caes, se acaba tu turno.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Caes y tu turno se acaba.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico El objetivo se distrae y se le impone un penalizador -3 por estatus a las salvaciones de Percepción y de Voluntad durante 1 minuto. El objetivo puede ponerle fin al efecto antes de tiempo con una réplica a tu Comentario agudo. Esto puede ser una acción individual que tenga el rasgo concentrarse o una acción de habilidad apropiada para enmarcar su réplica. El DJ determina qué acciones de habilidad cumplen los requisitos, aunque deben requerir al menos 1 acción. Normalmente, la réplica requiere utilizar una acción de habilidad lingüística basada en el Carisma. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.CtrZFI3RV0yPNzTv]{Efecto: Comentario Agudo (Éxito crítico)}
Notes.success: Éxito El objetivo se distrae y se le impone un penalizador -2 por estatus a las salvaciones de Percepción y de Voluntad durante 1 minuto. El objetivo puede ponerle fin al efecto antes de tiempo con una réplica a tu Comentario agudo. Esto puede ser una acción individual que tenga el rasgo concentrarse o una acción de habilidad apropiada para enmarcar su réplica. El DJ determina qué acciones de habilidad cumplen los requisitos, aunque deben requerir al menos 1 acción. Normalmente, la réplica requiere utilizar una acción de habilidad lingüística basada en el Carisma. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.GoSls6SKCFmSoDxT]{Efecto: Comentario Agudo}
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Tu ocurrencia es espantosa. Se te impone el mismo penalizador que se le impondría al enemigo si tuvieras éxito. Esto termina al cabo de 1 minuto o si sueltas otro Comentario agudo y tienes éxito. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.GoSls6SKCFmSoDxT]{Efecto: Comentario Agudo}

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Subes, bajas o te mueves de lado de forma segura por la pendiente a lo largo de 5 pies (1,5 m) más 5 pies (1,5 m) por cada 20 pies (6 m) de tu Velocidad terrestre (o sea, un total de 10 pies [3 m] para la mayoría de PJs).
Notes.success: Éxito Subes, bajas o te mueves de lado de forma segura por la pendiente a lo largo de 5 pies (1,5 m) por cada 20 pies (6 m) de tu Velocidad terrestre (un total de 5 pies [1,5 m] para la mayoría de PJs, mínimo 5 pies [1,5 m] si tu Velocidad está por debajo de 20 pies [6 m]).
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Te caes. Si empezaste a moverte sobre terreno estable, quedas derribado como consecuencia de la caída. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico El objetivo te facilita la información que buscas o se muestra de acuerdo en seguir tus instrucciones si éstas no pueden dañarle en modo alguno. El objetivo continúa estando de acuerdo durante una cantidad de tiempo determinada por el DJ pero no superior a 1 día, en cuyo momento se vuelve malintencionado (si aún no era malintencionado u hostil). Sin embargo, el objetivo tiene demasiado miedo de ti como para tomar represalias; por lo menos, a corto plazo.
Notes.success: Éxito Como éxito crítico, pero una vez el objetivo se vuelve malintencionado puede decidir actuar contra ti; por ejemplo dando parte de tu comportamiento a las autoridades o ayudando a tus enemigos.
Notes.failure: Fallo El objetivo no hace lo que tú dices y, si aún no era malintencionado u hostil, se vuelve malintencionado.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico El objetivo rehúsa cumplir tus órdenes, se vuelve hostil si aún no lo era y no puede ser Obligado por ti durante al menos 1 semana.

Error.ItemReferenceMismatch: Only accepts physical items for Craft from a compendium or the world's Item Directory.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Crafting reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level + 1 and your proficiency rank in Crafting.
Notes.success: Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Crafting reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level and your proficiency rank.
Notes.failure: Failure You fail to complete the item. You can salvage the raw materials you supplied for their full value. If you want to try again, you must start over.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You fail to complete the item. You ruin 10% of the raw materials you supplied, but you can salvage the rest. If you want to try again, you must start over.

Warning.NotPhysicalItem: Specified item {item} is not a physical item.
Warning.MissingItem: Unable to Craft unknown item with ID {uuid}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The animal does as you command on its next turn.
Notes.success: Success The animal does as you command on its next turn.
Notes.failure: Failure The animal is hesitant or resistant, and it does nothing.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The animal misbehaves or misunderstands, and it takes some other action determined by the GM.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to each creature whose Perception DC is less than or equal to your result. (The hidden condition allows you to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} away.) This lasts until the end of your turn or until you do anything except Step or use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} action of the Stealth skill. If you Strike a creature, the creature remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against that attack, and you then become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed}. If you do anything else, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} just before you act unless the GM determines otherwise.
Notes.success: Success You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to each creature whose Perception DC is less than or equal to your result. (The hidden condition allows you to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} away.) This lasts until the end of your turn or until you do anything except Step or use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} action of the Stealth skill. If you Strike a creature, the creature remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against that attack, and you then become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed}. If you do anything else, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} just before you act unless the GM determines otherwise.
Notes.failure: Failure You don't divert the attention of any creatures whose Perception DC exceeds your result, and those creatures are aware you were trying to trick them.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You don't divert the attention of any creatures whose Perception DC exceeds your result, and those creatures are aware you were trying to trick them.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.
Notes.success: Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You knock the item out of the opponent's grasp. It falls to the ground in the opponent's space.
Notes.success: Success You weaken your opponent's grasp on the item. Until the start of that creature's turn, attempts to Disarm the opponent of that item gain a +2 circumstance bonus, and the target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to attacks with the item or other checks requiring a firm grasp on the item. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.z3ATL8DcRVrT0Uzt]{Effect: Disarm (Success)}
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You lose your balance and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn.

EncouragingWords.Title: Encouraging Words
EncouragingWords.ContentMain: Select a target DC. Remember that you can't attempt a heal above your proficiency. Attempting to do so will downgrade the DC and amount healed to the highest you're capable of.
EncouragingWords.BadArgs: This action must be performed with exactly one character or NPC.
EncouragingWords.NotTrained: {name} is not trained in Diplomacy and doesn't know how to use Encouraging Words.
EncouragingWords.StaminaNotEnabled: The Stamina variant is not enabled.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You throw your enemy's defenses against you entirely off. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against melee attacks that you attempt against it until the end of your next turn.
Notes.success: Success Your foe is fooled, but only momentarily. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the next melee attack that you attempt against it before the end of your current turn.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Your feint backfires. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against melee attacks the target attempts against you until the end of your next turn.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You open the door, window, container, or gate and can avoid damaging it in the process.
Notes.success: Success You break the door, window, container, or gate open, and the door, window, container, or gate gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} condition. If it's especially sturdy, the GM might have it take damage but not be broken.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Your attempt jams the door, window, container, or gate shut, imposing a -2 circumstance penalty on future attempts to Force it Open.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You collect information about the individual or topic. The GM determines the specifics.
Notes.success: Success You collect information about the individual or topic. The GM determines the specifics.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You collect incorrect information about the individual or topic.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Your opponent is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} until the end of your next turn unless you move or your opponent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.
Notes.success: Success Your opponent is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of your next turn unless you move or your opponent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.
Notes.failure: Failure You fail to grab your opponent. If you already had the opponent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} using a Grapple, those conditions on that creature end.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure If you already had the opponent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, it breaks free. Your target can either grab you, as if it succeeded at using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} action against you, or force you to fall and land @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success If the creature could see you, you're now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it instead of observed. If you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature, you retain that condition.
Notes.success: Success If the creature could see you, you're now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it instead of observed. If you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature, you retain that condition.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Increase the maximum vertical distance to 8 feet, or increase the maximum vertical distance to 5 feet and maximum horizontal distance to 10 feet.
Notes.success: Success Increase the maximum vertical distance to 5 feet.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You don't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} at all, and instead you fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in your space.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You trick the creature into thinking you're the person you're disguised as. You might have to attempt a new check if your behavior changes.
Notes.success: Success You trick the creature into thinking you're the person you're disguised as. You might have to attempt a new check if your behavior changes.
Notes.failure: Failure The creature can tell you're not who you claim to be.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The creature can tell you're not who you claim to be, and it recognizes you if it would know you without a disguise.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target believes your lie.
Notes.success: Success The target believes your lie.
Notes.failure: Failure The target doesn't believe your lie and gains a +4 circumstance bonus against your attempts to Lie for the duration of your conversation. The target is also more likely to be suspicious of you in the future.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The target doesn't believe your lie and gains a +4 circumstance bonus against your attempts to Lie for the duration of your conversation. The target is also more likely to be suspicious of you in the future.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Increase the maximum horizontal distance you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} to the desired distance.
Notes.success: Success Increase the maximum horizontal distance you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} to the desired distance.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} normally, but then fall and land @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target's attitude toward you improves by two steps.
Notes.success: Success The target's attitude toward you improves by one step.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The target's attitude toward you decreases by one step.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You succeed at the maneuver.
Notes.success: Success You succeed at the maneuver.
Notes.failure: Failure Your maneuver fails. The GM chooses if you simply can't move or if some other detrimental effect happens. The outcome should be appropriate for the maneuver you attempted (for instance, being blown off course if you were trying to fly against a strong wind).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure As failure, but the consequence is more dire.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You unlock the lock, or you achieve two successes toward opening a complex lock. You leave no trace of your tampering.
Notes.success: Success You open the lock, or you achieve one success toward opening a complex lock.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You break your tools. Fixing them requires using Crafting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} them or else swapping in replacement picks (costing 3 sp, or 3 gp for infiltrator thieves' tools).

RaiseAShield.BadArgs: This action must be performed with exactly one character or NPC.

Chat.ItemRepaired: {itemName} was repaired for {repairedDamage} points of damage for a total of {afterRepairHitPoints} out of {maximumHitPoints} hit points.
Chat.ItemDamaged: {itemName} was dealt {damageDealt} points of damage for a total of {afterDamageHitPoints} out of {maximumHitPoints} hit points.

Error.ItemReferenceMismatch: Only accepts physical items for Repair from an actor.

Labels.DamageMitigatedByHardness: The critically failed Repair attempt caused no damage to the item due to hardness.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You restore 10 Hit Points to the item, plus an additional 10 Hit Points per proficiency rank you have in Crafting (a total of 20 HP if you're trained, 30 HP if you're an expert, 40 HP if you're a master, or 50 HP if you're legendary).
Notes.success: Success You restore 5 Hit Points to the item, plus an additional 5 per proficiency rank you have in Crafting (for a total of 10 HP if you are trained, 15 HP if you're an expert, 20 HP if you're a master, or 25 HP if you're legendary).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You deal 2d6 damage to the item. Apply the item's Hardness to this damage.

Warning.NotPhysicalItem: Specified item {item} is not a physical item.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target agrees to your request without qualifications.
Notes.success: Success The target agrees to your request, but they might demand added provisions or alterations to the request.
Notes.failure: Failure The target refuses the request, though they might propose an alternative that is less extreme.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Not only does the target refuse the request, but their attitude toward you decreases by one step due to the temerity of the request.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success If you were searching for creatures, any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature you critically succeeded against becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} by you. If you were searching for an object, you learn its location.
Notes.success: Success If you were searching for creatures, any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creature you succeeded against becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from you instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, and any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature you succeeded against becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} by you. If you were searching for an object, you learn its location or get a clue to its whereabouts, as determined by the GM.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You get an excellent sense of where you are. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you know them exactly.
Notes.success: Success You gain enough orientation to avoid becoming hopelessly lost. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you have a sense of those directions.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You determine the creature's true intentions and get a solid idea of any mental magic affecting it.
Notes.success: Success You can tell whether the creature is behaving normally, but you don't know its exact intentions or what magic might be affecting it.
Notes.failure: Failure You detect what a deceptive creature wants you to believe. If they're not being deceptive, you believe they're behaving normally.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You get a false sense of the creature's intentions.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You push your opponent up to 10 feet away from you. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.
Notes.success: Success You push your opponent back 5 feet. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You lose your balance, fall, and land @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You're undetected by the creature during your movement and remain undetected by the creature at the end of it.
Notes.success: Success You're undetected by the creature during your movement and remain undetected by the creature at the end of it.
Notes.failure: Failure A telltale sound or other sign gives your position away, though you still remain unseen. You're hidden from the creature throughout your movement and remain so
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You're spotted! You're observed by the creature throughout your movement and remain so. If you're invisible and were hidden from the creature, instead of being observed you're hidden throughout your movement and remain so.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You squeeze through the tight space in 1 minute per 10 feet of squeezing.
Notes.success: Success You squeeze through in 1 minute per 5 feet.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You become stuck in the tight space. While you're stuck, you can spend 1 minute attempting another Acrobatics check at the same DC. Any result on that check other than a critical failure causes you to become unstuck.

SteelYourResolve.Title: Steel Your Resolve
SteelYourResolve.Content: Spend a resolve point and regain stamina?
SteelYourResolve.BadArgs: This action must be performed with exactly one character or NPC.
SteelYourResolve.StaminaNotEnabled: The Stamina variant is not enabled.
SteelYourResolve.NoStamina: {name} is tired and needs to go to bed! No resolve points remaining.
SteelYourResolve.RecoverStamina: {name} has {ratio} SP and spends a resolve point, recovering half their maximum Stamina.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You move through the water 10 feet, plus 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 15 feet for most PCs).
Notes.success: Success You move through the water 5 feet, plus 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 10 feet for most PCs).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You make no progress, and if you're holding your breath, you lose 1 round of air.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Your tampering is incredibly effective. If you tampered with a weapon, the enemy takes a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls with that weapon. If you tampered with armor, the armor hampers the enemy's movement, making the enemy flat-footed and inflicting a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds. The effect lasts until the enemy Interacts to remove it, regardless of which one you used. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.rzcpTJU9MvW1x1gz]{Effect: Armor Tampered With (Critical Success)} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.o7qm13OmaYOMwgib]{Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Critical Success)}
Notes.success: Success Your tampering is temporarily effective. As critical success, but the effect ends at the start of your next turn, even if the enemy doesn't Interact to end it. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.IfRkgjyh0JzGalIy]{Effect: Armor Tampered With (Success)} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.4QWayYR3JSL9bk2T]{Effect: Weapon Tampered With (Success)}
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Your tampering backfires dramatically, creating a small explosion from your own tools or gear. You take [[/r {@details.level.value}[fire] # Tamper Backfire]]{fire damage equal to your level}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You find the trail or continue to follow the one you're already following.
Notes.success: Success You find the trail or continue to follow the one you're already following.
Notes.failure: Failure You lose the trail but can try again after a 1-hour delay.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You lose the trail and can't try again for 24 hours.

Notes.criticalSuccess:
Critical Success You grant the creature a +4 circumstance bonus to its next saving throw against the disease.
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.id20P4pj7zDKeLmy]{Effect: Treat Disease (Critical Success)}
Notes.success:

Abomination.Label: Abomination
Abomination.Description: You seek to instill abhorrence and horror in those around you.

AirApocryphal.Label: Aire (apócrifo)
AirApocryphal.Description: Controlas vientos y clima. No todas las tradiciones clericales se enseñan entre la ortodoxia. Algunos se susurran en secreto, se transmiten de sacerdotes a acólitos de confianza o se escriben en tomos dejados por facciones disidentes.

Ambition.Label: Ambición
Ambition.Description: Te esfuerzas por mantenerte al día y superar a la competencia.

AmbitionApocryphal.Label: Ambición (apócrifo)
AmbitionApocryphal.Description: Te esfuerzas por mantenerte al día y superar a la competencia. No todas las tradiciones clericales se enseñan entre la ortodoxia. Algunos se susurran en secreto, se transmiten de sacerdotes a acólitos de confianza o se escriben en tomos dejados por facciones disidentes.

Change.Label: Change
Change.Description: You can restructure the physical and metaphysical.

Cities.Label: Cities
Cities.Description: You have powers over urban environments and denizens.

Cold.Label: Cold
Cold.Description: You control ice, snow, and freezing temperatures.

Confidence.Label: Confidence
Confidence.Description: You overcome your fear and project pride.

ConfidenceApocryphal.Label: Confidence (apocryphal)
ConfidenceApocryphal.Description: You overcome your fear and project pride. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Creation.Label: Creation
Creation.Description: You have divine abilities related to crafting and art.

Darkness.Label: Darkness
Darkness.Description: You operate in the darkness and take away the light.

DarknessApocryphal.Label: Darkness (apocryphal)
DarknessApocryphal.Description: You operate in the darkness and take away the light. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Death.Label: Death
Death.Description: You have the power to end lives and destroy undead.

DeathApocryphal.Label: Death (apocryphal)
DeathApocryphal.Description: You have the power to end lives and destroy undead. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Decay.Label: Decay
Decay.Description: You have the power to spoil and deteriorate matter.

Delirium.Label: Delirium
Delirium.Description: You can bring about hallucinations and restlessness.

Destruction.Label: Destruction
Destruction.Description: You are a conduit for divine devastation.

Dreams.Label: Dreams
Dreams.Description: You have the power to enter and manipulate dreams.

Dust.Label: Dust
Dust.Description: You have the power to dry and crumble what opposes you.

Duty.Label: Duty
Duty.Description: You defend oaths and carry out your divine missions with great dedication.

Family.Label: Family
Family.Description: You aid and protect your family and community more effectively.

Fate.Label: Fate
Fate.Description: You see and understand hidden inevitabilities.

FateApocryphal.Label: Fate (apocryphal)
FateApocryphal.Description: You see and understand hidden inevitabilities. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

FireApocryphal.Label: Fire (apocryphal)
FireApocryphal.Description: You control flame. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Freedom.Label: Freedom
Freedom.Description: You liberate yourself and others from shackles and constraints.

Glyph.Label: Glyph
Glyph.Description: You wield power over written words and symbols.

Healing.Label: Healing
Healing.Description: Your healing magic is particularly potent.

Indulgence.Label: Indulgence
Indulgence.Description: You feast mightily and can shake off the effects of overindulging.

IndulgenceApocryphal.Label: Indulgence (apocryphal)
IndulgenceApocryphal.Description: You feast mightily and can shake off the effects of overindulging. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

KnowledgeApocryphal.Label: Knowledge (apocryphal)
KnowledgeApocryphal.Description: You receive divine insights. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Lightning.Label: Lightning
Lightning.Description: You control electricity, thunder, and storms.

Luck.Label: Luck
Luck.Description: You're unnaturally lucky and keep out of harm's way.

Magic.Label: Magic
Magic.Description: You perform the unexpected and inexplicable.

Might.Label: Might
Might.Description: Your physical power is bolstered by divine strength.

MightApocryphal.Label: Might (apocryphal)
MightApocryphal.Description: Your physical power is bolstered by divine strength. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Moon.Label: Moon
Moon.Description: You command powers associated with the moon.

Naga.Label: Naga
Naga.Description: Like the serpentine nagas, you're in tune with cosmic forces that Ravithra once controlled.

Nature.Label: Nature
Nature.Description: You hold power over animals and plants.

Nightmares.Label: Nightmares
Nightmares.Description: You fill minds with horror and dread.

Pain.Label: Pain
Pain.Description: You punish those who displease you with the sharp sting of pain.

Passion.Label: Passion
Passion.Description: You evoke passion, whether as love or lust.

Perfection.Label: Perfection
Perfection.Description: You strive to perfect your mind, body, and spirit.

Plague.Label: Plague
Plague.Description: You wield disease and pestilence like a weapon.

Secrecy.Label: Secrecy
Secrecy.Description: You protect secrets and keep them hidden.

SecrecyApocryphal.Label: Secrecy (apocryphal)
SecrecyApocryphal.Description: You protect secrets and keep them hidden. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Sorrow.Label: Sorrow
Sorrow.Description: You have a painful connection to melancholy and sadness.

Soul.Label: Soul
Soul.Description: You wield power over the spiritual.

Star.Label: Star
Star.Description: You command the power of the stars.

Sun.Label: Sun
Sun.Description: You harness the power of the sun and other light sources, and punish undead.

Swarm.Label: Swarm
Swarm.Description: You exert control over masses of creatures.

Time.Label: Time
Time.Description: You reign over the flow of time.

Toil.Label: Toil
Toil.Description: You work constantly and refuse to let anything stand in your way.

Travel.Label: Travel
Travel.Description: You have power over movement and journeys.

TravelApocryphal.Label: Travel (apocryphal)
TravelApocryphal.Description: You have power over movement and journeys. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Trickery.Label: Trickery
Trickery.Description: You deceive others and cause mischief.

Truth.Label: Truth
Truth.Description: You pierce lies and discover the truth.

Tyranny.Label: Tyranny
Tyranny.Description: You wield power to rule and enslave others.

Undeath.Label: Undeath
Undeath.Description: Your magic carries close ties to the undead.

Vigil.Label: Vigil
Vigil.Description: You watch over those long passed and guard their secrets.

Water.Label: Water
Water.Description: You control water and bodies of water.

WaterApocryphal.Label: Water (apocryphal)
WaterApocryphal.Description: You control water and bodies of water. Not all clerical traditions are taught among the orthodoxy. Some are whispered in secret, passed down from a priest to trusted acolytes or scribed in tomes left behind by splinter factions.

Wealth.Label: Wealth
Wealth.Description: You hold power over wealth, trade, and treasure.

Wyrmkin.Label: Wyrmkin
Wyrmkin.Description: You draw on the power of dragons, linnorms, and other powerful reptilian creatures.

Zeal.Label: Zeal
Zeal.Description: Your inner fire increases your combat prowess.

Warning.InvalidLevel: Intenté agregar el conjuro {name} a {targetLevel}, pero el conjuro es {baseLevel}.

CriticalSpecialization.axe: Elige una criatura adyacente al objetivo inicial y al alcance. Si su CA es inferior al resultado de tu tirada de ataque para el golpe crítico, infliges daño a esa criatura igual al resultado del dado de daño de arma que tiraste (incluidos los dados adicionales para su runa de potencia, si los hay). Esta cantidad no se duplica y no se aplican bonificaciones u otros dados adicionales a este daño.
CriticalSpecialization.bomb: Aumenta el radio del daño por salpicadura de la bomba (si lo hay) a 10 pies.
CriticalSpecialization.bow: Si el objetivo del golpe crítico está adyacente a una superficie, el proyectil lo pega a esa superficie. El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} y debe gastar una acción Interactuar para intentar una verificación de @Check[type:athletics|dc:10|name:Liberar el proyectil|showDC:all] para liberar el proyectil; no puede moverse de su espacio hasta que tenga éxito. La criatura no se atasca si es incorpórea, es líquida (como un elemental de agua o algunos cienos) o podría escapar sin esfuerzo.
CriticalSpecialization.brawling: El objetivo debe tener éxito en @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true|name:Brawling Critical Specialization|showDC:all]  o ser @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Ralentizado 1} hasta el final de tu próximo turno.
CriticalSpecialization.club: Golpeas al objetivo lejos de ti hasta 10 pies (tú eliges la distancia). Este es un movimiento forzado.
CriticalSpecialization.dart: El objetivo recibe @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]. Obtienes una bonificación de objeto a este daño por sangrado igual a la bonificación de objeto del arma a las tiradas de ataque.

CriticalSpecialization.knife: El objetivo recibe @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]. Obtienes una bonificación de objeto a este daño por sangrado igual a la bonificación de objeto del arma a las tiradas de ataque.

GeneratedName.Hint: This is the name of the base weapon. For most weapons, the base is used to generate a fuller name, taking into account the material composition and/or runes. Giving this weapon a custom name or marking it as "specific" will prevent the generated name from appearing.

Weapon.MandatoryMelee: Esta arma tiene un rasgo que solo se puede usar con armas cuerpo a cuerpo.

MaterialAndRunes.Title: Materiales y runas
MaterialAndRunes.Hint: El material precioso y las runas permiten una personalización profunda de un arma. Además de mejorar su capacidad para dañar a los enemigos, también afectan el nivel, la rareza, el precio y el nombre del arma. Para suprimir el cambio de nombre de un arma, asígnele un nombre personalizado o márquelo como un arma mágica específica.

MeleeUsage.Label: Uso cuerpo a cuerpo
MeleeUsage.Hint: Un arma combinada tiene una forma o uso de arma de fuego y una forma o uso de arma cuerpo a cuerpo. Cambiar entre el uso de armas cuerpo a cuerpo y el uso de armas de fuego requiere una acción Interactuar. Sin embargo, si tu última acción fue un Golpe cuerpo a cuerpo exitoso contra un enemigo usando un arma combinada, puedes hacer un Golpe de arma de fuego con el arma combinada contra ese enemigo sin cambiar completamente al uso del arma de fuego, disparando el arma de fuego justo cuando golpeas con el cuerpo a cuerpo. ataque. En este caso, el arma combinada vuelve a su uso cuerpo a cuerpo después del Ataque con arma de fuego.

RangeIncrementN.Label: Incremento de rango {range} pies.
RangeIncrementN.Hint: Las armas a distancia y arrojadizas tienen un incremento de alcance. Los ataques con estas armas funcionan normalmente hasta esa distancia. Las tiradas de ataque más allá del incremento de alcance de un arma reciben una penalización de -2 por cada múltiplo adicional de ese incremento entre tú y el objetivo. Los ataques más allá del sexto incremento de rango son imposibles.

SpecificMagicWeapon.Label: Arma Mágica Específica
SpecificMagicWeapon.Hint: Marcar esta arma como arma mágica específica indica que hace más de lo que permiten su composición material y sus runas. El nombre, el nivel, la rareza y el precio ya no se anularán de un material precioso o runas al momento de marcar. Sin embargo, esos materiales y runas servirán como referencia para los ajustes de nivel, rareza y precio de actualizaciones posteriores.

PF2E.PreciousMaterialAbysiumDescription: A blue-green metal with an eerie green luminescence, abysium radiates power that's inimical to life. Careless exposure to the material can lead to long‑term damage to the immune system; as such, mining abysium is hazardous, as large quantities of the metal in an area cause all nearby creatures to become sick. A creature carrying an abysium object is sickened 1 for a standard‑grade object of light Bulk, sickened 2 for a standard‑grade object of 1 Bulk or more or a high-grade object of light Bulk, or sickened 3 for a high‑grade object of 1 Bulk or more. This and all other sickening effects of abysium are poison effects. Crafters can use 1 abysium chunk to create up to 6 doses of poisonous abysium powder. Unscrupulous smiths have harnessed abysium's toxic properties to create noxious weapons and deadly substances. All objects crafted from abysium shed dim light in a 10‑foot radius.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialAdamantineDescription: Mined from rocks that fell from the heavens, adamantine is one of the hardest metals known. It has a shiny, black appearance, and it is prized for its amazing resiliency and ability to hold an incredibly sharp edge.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialColdIronDescription: Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike. Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDarkwoodDescription: Darkwood is a very lightweight wood found primarily in old- growth forests in south-central Avistan; it is dark as ebony but has a slight purple tint. A darkwood item's Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of darkwood is based on the item's normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of darkwood, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDjezetDescription: This rust red metal is liquid at room temperature, making it challenging for all but the most skilled metallurgists to craft with and earning it the name "quickiron" in some places. Djezet is also extremely reactive to magic, even in its solid, workable alloyed form. It glows when targeted by magic, and objects crafted with djezet alloys glow with scarlet striations, which lead some smiths to nickname it "tiger iron." When targeted by spells, objects crafted from djezet alloys exhibit these glowing red markings that last for 1 round or the duration of the spell, whichever is longer. A djezet mass contains enough djezet to refine into up to two djezet doses.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDragonhideDescription: The hide and scales of a dragon can be used to Craft any item normally made of ordinary leather or hide. Dragonhide varies in color from blue to glittering gold, depending on the dragon it came from. Due to the scales' resiliency, it can also be used to Craft armor usually made out of metal plates (such as a breastplate, half plate, and full plate), allowing such armor to be made without metal. Dragonhide objects are immune to one damage type, depending on the type of dragon.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialGrisantianPeltDescriptio: This supernaturally tough animal skin is gold and shines in sunlight. It can be used to make any item usually made of cloth, leather, or hide. This material is immune to fire, and its Hardness is doubled against piercing or slashing damage. Up to 4 Bulk of grisantian pelt can be harvested from a single creature (this is usually more than enough for 4 suits of standard grade armor or 2 suit of high-grade armor).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialInubrixDescription: This pale, malleable metal's unusual molecular structure allows it to partially pass through iron and steel without touching them. While this property is useful for making weapons that bypass metal armor, inubrix is barely sturdier than lead. Even in an alloyed state, this skymetal is so fragile that it's difficult to use in crafting reliable shields and less than ideal for crafting armor.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialMithralDescription: Mithral is renowned for its lightness, durability, and effectiveness against a range of creatures including devils and lycanthropes. It has the same sheen as silver but a slightly lighter hue. Mithral weapons and armor are treated as if they were silver for the purpose of damaging creatures with weakness to silver. A metal item made of mithral is lighter than one made of iron or steel: the item's Bulk is reduced by 1 (reduced to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of this material is based on the item's normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of mithral, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialNoqualDescription: Light and strong, noqual also demonstrates a powerful resistance to magic. A side effect of this resistance is that making magical weapons out of noqual requires complex and expensive alchemical treatments. Kevoth‑Kul, the Black Sovereign of Numeria, has developed an alloy of noqual and cold iron known as sovereign steel to help mitigate this property. The metal's crystalline appearance might suggest that it's fragile, but the pale‑green material can be worked similarly to iron. Objects made of noqual have a +4 circumstance bonus on saves against magic that the item attempts and grant their bonus to saves the owner makes specifically to protect the item from magic (such as against the rusting grasp spell).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialOrichalcumDescription: The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn't as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum's time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn't destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialPeachwoodDescription: Peachwood weapons have a particularly auburn tinge to them when under direct sunlight. Peachwood is treated as darkwood for any undead creatures' resistances or weaknesses related to darkwood (allowing a peachwood weapon to bypass a jiang-shi's resistance, for example). In addition, peachwood weapons bypass a small portion of the resistances of any undead creature. Strikes with a peachwood weapon treat an undead's resistances against physical damage as 2 lower for standard-grade peachwood, and 4 lower for high-grade.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSiccatiteDescription: In its raw state, this silvery ore is either scalding hot or freezing cold. Metallurgists disagree over whether siccatite is two related substances or one substance that determines its temperature output via some unknown process. Whatever the reason, the extreme temperature of the material means it must be handled carefully. Hot siccatite can easily ignite flammables such as paper and dry brush, and cold siccatite left in moist areas quickly surrounds itself with a thick layer of ice. A creature that comes into physical contact with a significant amount of siccatite takes 1 energy Damage for each round of continued contact (either fire or cold damage, for hot and cold siccatite respectively).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSilverDescription: Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSisterstoneDescription: Sisterstone is a term used for two closely related ores infused by the spiritual runoff in the Field of Maidens, dusk sisterstone and scarlet sisterstone. They have the same physical properties except for color-dusk sisterstone is a pale orange while scarlet sisterstone is orange-red. When near an object made of the other type of sisterstone, they both begin exuding spiritual energy that repels undead.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSovereignSteelDescriptio: Created by Black Sovereign Kevoth-Kul, this unique alloy of cold iron and the skymetal noqual can provide protection from magical assault. The process of cold-forging the two materials together is quite complicated and precise. Characters in search of sovereign steel weapons and armor will almost assuredly have to travel to Starfall to procure gear made from this rare alloy. While some believe it possible to craft shields of sovereign steel as well, in one of his fits, Kevoth-Kul yelled that he had no use for them and banned anyone from making such a thing. So far, his smiths have been too afraid to confirm whether or not it was a joke. All sovereign steel items (including weapon and armor below) have a +4 circumstance bonus on saves against magic that the item makes, and grant their bonus to saves the owner makes specifically to protect the item from magic (such as against the rusting grasp spell).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialWarpglassDescription: This bizarre substance is fashioned from the raw, chaotic quintessence of the Maelstrom. It can be fashioned into weapons and items, but is too unstable to make into useful armor or shields. Raw warpglass is an opalescent glassy material with surprising strength. When worked, it changes its appearance-though not its properties-to appear as random striations of other metals and types of stone.

Homebrew.Instructions: Estos ajustes permiten a los DJ añadir características, idiomas y otros elementos a un mundo casero. Para agregar dichos elementos, simplemente escriba los términos deseados en los campos apropiados, separados por comas o teclas de tabulación. Luego aparecerán en los lugares apropiados en las hojas de actores y elementos. Para actualizar un término, haga clic en él para realizar los cambios deseados.

PF2E.SettingsQuickRollsNotes: Si está deshabilitado, los cuadros de diálogo previos a las tiradas D20 aparecerán solo cuando se haga clic+shift en un botón de tirada.
PF2E.SettingsDataUriHighlightLabel: Highlight images that use data: URI
PF2E.SettingsDataUriHighlightNotes:
Images that use a data: URI are embedded in the character sheet. This has a negative performance impact on the character. If enabled, such images will be highlighted with a red border to make it easy to find and remove them.
This setting is only active for the current session.

PF2E.ShieldCurrentTitle: Los Puntos de Golpe del escudo
PF2E.ShieldHardnessTitle: El escudo se reduce en este valor
PF2E.SpellBrowserSearchHint:
You can search for name or custom attributes. Possible searchable attributes are:
source, spellType, level, school, components, materials, target, range, time, duration, damage, damageType, save, concentration, ritual, ability and classes.
Example: 'fire, damage:d6' to show all spells that have fire in their name and a d6 in the damage
PF2E.SpellSlotNotEnoughError: No puedes lanzar {name} a {level}, no hay suficientes espacios de conjuro

Default.Description: You attack with a weapon you're wielding or with an unarmed attack, targeting one creature within your reach (for a melee attack) or within range (for a ranged attack). Roll the attack roll for the weapon or unarmed attack you are using, and compare the result to the target creature's AC to determine the effect.
Default.CriticalSuccess: As success, but you deal double damage.
Default.Success: You deal damage according to the weapon or unarmed attack, including any modifiers, bonuses, and penalties you have to damage.

Unarmed.Description: You attack with an unarmed attack, targeting one creature within your reach. Roll the attack roll for the unarmed attack you are using, and compare the result to the target creature's AC to determine the effect.
Unarmed.Success: You deal damage according to the unarmed attack, including any modifiers, bonuses, and penalties you have to damage.

Melee.Description: You attack with a weapon you're wielding, targeting one creature within your reach. Roll the attack roll for the weapon you are using, and compare the result to the target creature's AC to determine the effect.
Melee.Success: You deal damage according to the weapon, including any modifiers, bonuses, and penalties you have to damage.

Ranged.Description: You attack with a weapon you're wielding, targeting one creature within range. Roll the attack roll for the weapon you are using, and compare the result to the target creature's AC to determine the effect.
Ranged.Success: You deal damage according to the weapon, including any modifiers, bonuses, and penalties you have to damage.
Ranged.NoAmmo: No ammunition is assigned to {weapon}. Check the Actions tab of {actor}'s sheet.

Combined.Description: You attack with a weapon you're wielding, targeting one creature within your reach (for a melee attack) or within range (for a ranged attack). Roll the attack roll for the weapon or unarmed attack you are using, and compare the result to the target creature's AC to determine the effect.
Combined.Success: You deal damage according to the weapon, including any modifiers, bonuses, and penalties you have to damage.

PF2E.TemporaryItemToolTip: This item is temporary and will expire after a duration or during daily preparations. It has no value and cannot be sold.
